Is it possible to transplant conversion modules from one part to another? I want to move the fertilizer production away from the ISRUs and into the SSPX Aquaculture lab, to give it some functionality outside of being a resource recycler.

> 
> 
> 19 minutes ago, Red Dwarf said:
> 
> 
> Is it possible to transplant conversion modules from one part to another? I want to move the fertilizer production away from the ISRUs and into the SSPX Aquaculture lab, to give it some functionality outside of being a resource recycler.
> 

Sure, ModuleManager is your friend.
Git Link is broken.
Check the UmbraSpaceIndustries repo.
[This way for your <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> fix.](https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/UmbraSpaceIndustries/releases)
Question, does <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS have any compatability with Snacks!

No, they largely do similar things (<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS does a lot more, like habitation etc, Snacks is simpler) so they are not compatible by design and you shouldn't use them together - pick one or the other (or even another life support mod like Kerbalism or TAC-LS).

I just wanted to know if I could use the snack canisters from Snacks! for the supplies in <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS so I don't have to restart the save or worse, use them both at the same time.

The only potentially problematic thing I can think of is if you have some vessels in flight that have those parts attached. If you then remove Snacks and try to load your save, any vessels currently in flight that have snack canisters attached will be destroyed. 

If you are determined you can of course delete the rest of the Snacks mod files and just keep the snack canisters (you'd have to strip out the Snacks specific config though), or even write custom <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patches to give them the same functionality as <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> ones. That way you can keep your vessels.

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, Grimmas said:
> 
> 
> The only potentially problematic thing I can think of is if you have some vessels in flight that have those parts attached. If you then remove Snacks and try to load your save, any vessels currently in flight that have snack canisters attached will be destroyed. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> If you are determined you can of course delete the rest of the Snacks mod files and just keep the snack canisters (you'd have to strip out the Snacks specific config though), or even write custom <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)"><abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr></abbr> patches to give them the same functionality as <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr> ones. That way you can keep your vessels.
> 

I like the idea of writing an <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch but I, uh, don't know how to do it. Can you offer a guide or some help?

There's not really much to it. It's all just text files. All configs basically live in a tree with nodes as branches and key-value pairs as leaves (someKey = someValue). ModuleManager reads all the various mods' config files - which either create new nodes or alter existing nodes - and it applies them in a predetermined order. [Read the docs](https://github.com/sarbian/ModuleManager/wiki/Module-Manager-Handbook) to get started if you are interested. It also helps to look at how other mods write their configs.
Thanks! If I get a chance I'll mess around with it this weekend!

> 
> 
> On 11/3/2021 at 6:49 AM, Grimmas said:
> 
> 
> No, they largely do similar things (<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)"><abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr></abbr>-LS does a lot more, like habitation etc, Snacks is simpler) so they are not compatible by design and you shouldn't use them together - pick one or the other (or even another life support mod like Kerbalism or TAC-LS).
> 

Kerbalism pretty much doesn't play well with anything that either relies on stock mechanics, or alters them - with some exceptions. <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS and TAC-LS are the safest bets if one plans to use any of the rest of the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> constellation, like MKS. That said, Snacks at least doesn't break the other <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> mods. (not saying don't use Kerbalism - it's awesome, and I have it installed on a different KSP instance)
